title: Evidence to Support Changes in Hurricanes

content.question: Based on the passage, which of the following pieces of evidence is used by the author to support the claim about hurricanes and climate change?

choices.label: Nine percent of hurricanes make landfall in urban areas.

The traditional Atlantic hurricane season stretches from June <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> through November <math alttext="30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The oceans have absorbed <math alttext="90%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the heat caused by human-generated greenhouse gases.
Hurricanes typically bring about <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> inches of rain to an area.

content.answer: The oceans have absorbed <math alttext="90%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the heat caused by human-generated greenhouse gases.
